1.verse: Adam, Sheth, Enosh,

2.verse: Kenan, Mahalaleel, Jered,

3.verse: Henoch, Methuselah, Lamech,

4.verse: Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

5.verse: The sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.

6.verse: And the sons of Gomer; Ashchenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.

7.verse: And the sons of Javan; Elisha, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

8.verse: The sons of Ham; Cush, and Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

9.verse: And the sons of Cush; Seba, and Havilah, and Sabta, and Raamah, and Sabtecha. And the sons of Raamah; Sheba, and Dedan.

10.verse: And Cush begat Nimrod. He began to be mighty upon the earth.

11.verse: And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,

12.verse: And Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (of whom came the Philistines,) and Caphthorim.

13.verse: And Canaan begat Zidon his first-born, and Heth,

14.verse: The Jebusite also, and the Amorite, and the Girgashite,

15.verse: And the Hivite, and the Archite, and the Sinite,

16.verse: And the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.

17.verse: The sons of Shem; Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram, and Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Meshech.

18.verse: And Arphaxad begat Shelah, and Shelah begat Eber.

19.verse: And to Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg; because in his days the earth was divided: and his brother's name was Joktan.

20.verse: And Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,

21.verse: Hadoram also, and Uzal, and Diklah,

22.verse: And Ebal, and Abimael, and Sheba,

23.verse: And Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

24.verse: Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,

25.verse: Eber, Peleg, Reu,

26.verse: Serug, Nahor, Terah,

28.verse: The sons of Abraham; Isaac, and Ishmael.

29.verse: These are their generations. The first-born of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,

30.verse: Mishma, and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,

31.verse: Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.

32.verse: Now the sons of Keturah, Abraham's concubine: she bore Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan; Sheba, and Dedan.

33.verse: And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Henoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these are the sons of Keturah,

34.verse: And Abraham begat Isaac. The sons of Isaac; Esau and Israel.

35.verse: The sons of Esau; Eliphaz, Reuel, and Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.

36.verse: The sons of Eliphaz; Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz, and Timna, and Amalek.

37.verse: The sons of Reuel; Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

38.verse: And the sons of Seir; Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah, and Dishon, and Ezar, and Dishan.

39.verse: And the sons of Lotan; Hori, and Homam: and Timna was Lotan's sister.

40.verse: The sons of Shobal; Alian, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon; Aiah, and Anah.

41.verse: The sons of Anah; Dishon. And the sons of Dishon; Amram, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.

42.verse: The sons of Ezer; Bilhan, and Zavan, and Jakan. The sons of Dishan; Uz, and Aran.

43.verse: Now these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the children of Israel; Bela the son of Beor: and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

44.verse: And when Bela was dead Jobab the son of Zera of Bozrah reigned in his stead.

45.verse: And when Jobab was dead, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.

46.verse: And when Husham was dead, Hadad the son of Bedad, who smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Avith.

47.verse: And when Hadad was dead, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.

48.verse: And when Samlah was dead, Shaul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.

49.verse: And when Shaul was dead, Baal-hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.

50.verse: And when Baal-hanan was dead, Hadad reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Pai; and his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.

51.verse: Hadad died also. And the dukes of Edom were; duke Timna, duke Aliah, duke Jetheth,

52.verse: Duke Aholibamah, duke Elah, duke Pinon,

53.verse: Duke Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,

54.verse: Duke Magdiel, duke Iram. These are the dukes of Edom.

1.verse: These are the sons of Israel; Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun,

2.verse: Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

3.verse: The sons of Judah; Er, and Onan, and Shelah: which three were born to him of the daughter of Shua the Canaanitess. And Er, the first-born of Judah, was evil in the sight of the LORD; and he slew him.

4.verse: And Tamar his daughter-in-law bore him Pharez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.

5.verse: The sons of Pharez; Hezron, and Hamul.

6.verse: And the sons of Zerah; Zimri, and Ethan, and Heman, and Calcol, and Dara: five of them in all.

7.verse: And the sons of Carmi; Achar, the troubler of Israel, who transgressed in the thing accursed.

8.verse: And the sons of Ethan; Azariah.

9.verse: The sons also of Hezron, that were born to him; Jerahmeel, and Ram, and Chelubai.

10.verse: And Ram begat Amminadab; and Amminadab begat Nahshon, prince of the children of Judah;

11.verse: And Nahshon begat Salma, and Salma begat Boaz,

12.verse: And Boaz begat Obed, and Obed begat Jesse,

13.verse: And Jesse begat his first-born Eliab, and Abinadab the second, and Shimma the third,

14.verse: Nethaneel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,

15.verse: Ozem the sixth, David the seventh:

16.verse: Whose sisters were Zeruiah, and Abigail. And the sons of Zeruiah; Abishai, and Joab, and Asahel, three.

17.verse: And Abigail bore Amasa: and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.

18.verse: And Caleb the son of Hezron begat children of Azubah his wife, and of Jerioth: her sons are these; Jesher, and Shobab, and Ardon.

19.verse: And when Azubah was dead, Caleb took to him Ephrath, who bore to him Hur,

20.verse: And Hur begat Uri, and Uri begat Bezaleel.

21.verse: And afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he married when he was sixty years old; and she bore him Segub.

22.verse: And Segub begat Jair, who had three and twenty cities in the land of Gilead.

23.verse: And he took Geshur, and Aram, with the towns of Jair, from them, with Kenath and its towns, even sixty cities. All these belonged to the sons of Machir, the father of Gilead.

24.verse: And after that Hezron was dead in Caleb-ephratah, then Abiah Hezron's wife bore him Ashur the father of Tekoa.

25.verse: And the sons of Jerahmeel the first-born of Hezron were, Ram the first-born, and Bunah, and Oren, and Ozem, and Ahijah.

26.verse: Jerahmeel had also another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.

27.verse: And the sons of Ram the first-born of Jerahmeel were, Maaz, and Jamin, and Eker.

28.verse: And the sons of Onam were, Shammai, and Jada. And the sons of Shammai; Nadab, and Abishur.

29.verse: And the name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail; and she bore him Ahban, and Molid.

30.verse: And the sons of Nadab; Seled, and Appaim: but Seled died without children.

31.verse: And the sons of Appaim; Ishi. And the sons of Ishi; Sheshan. And the children of Sheshan; Ahlai.

32.verse: And the sons of Jada the brother of Shammai; Jether, and Jonathan: and Jether died without children.

33.verse: And the sons of Jonathan; Peleth, and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.

34.verse: Now Sheshan had no sons, but daughters. And Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Jarha.

35.verse: And Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant for a wife; and she bore him Attai.

36.verse: And Attai begat Nathan, and Nathan begat Zabad,

37.verse: And Zabad begat Ephlal, and Ephlal begat Obed,

38.verse: And Obed begat Jehu, and Jehu begat Azariah,

39.verse: And Azariah begat Helez, and Helez begat Eleasah,

40.verse: And Eleasah begat Sisamai, and Sisamai begat Shallum,

41.verse: And Shallum begat Jekamiah, and Jekamiah begat Elishama.

42.verse: Now the sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were, Mesha his first-born, who was the father of Ziph; and the sons of Mareshah the father of Hebron.

43.verse: And the sons of Hebron; Korah, and Tappuah, and Rekem, and Shema.

44.verse: And Shema begat Raham, the father of Jorkoam: and Rekem begat Shammai.

45.verse: And the son of Shammai was Maon: and Maon was the father of Beth-zur.

46.verse: And Ephah, Caleb's concubine, bore Haran, and Moza, and Gazez: and Haran begat Gazez.

47.verse: And the sons of Jahdai; Regem, and Jotham, and Geshan, and Pelet, and Ephah, and Shaaph.

48.verse: Maachah, Caleb's concubine, bore Sheber, and Tirhanah.

49.verse: She bore also Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbenah, and the father of Gibea: and the daughter of Caleb was Achsah.

50.verse: These were the sons of Caleb the son of Hur, the first-born of Ephratah; Shobal the father of Kirjath-jearim,

51.verse: Salma the father of Beth-lehem, Hareph the father of Beth-gader.

52.verse: And Shobal the father of Kirjath-jearim had sons; Haroeh, and half of the Manahethites.

53.verse: And the families of Kirjath-jearim; the Ithrites, and the Puhites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; of them came the Zereathites, and the Eshtaulites.

54.verse: The sons of Salma; Beth-lehem, and the Netophathites, Ataroth, the house of Joab, and half of the Menahethites, the Zorites.

55.verse: And the families of the scribes who dwelt at Jabez; the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, and Suchathites. These are the Kenites that came of Hemath, the father of the house of Rechab.

1.verse: Now these were the sons of David, who were born to him in Hebron; the first-born Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; the second Daniel, of Abigail the Carmelitess:

2.verse: The third, Absalom the son of Maachah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur: the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith:

3.verse: The fifth, Shephatiah of Abital: the sixth, Ithream by Eglah his wife.

4.verse: These six were born to him in Hebron; and there he reigned seven years and six months: and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty and three years.

5.verse: And these were born to him in Jerusalem; Shimea, and Shobab, and Nathan, and Solomon, four, of Bath-shua the daughter of Ammiel:

6.verse: Ibhar also, and Elishama, and Eliphelet,

7.verse: And Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,

8.verse: And Elishama, and Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.

9.verse: These were all the sons of David, besides the sons of the concubines, and Tamar their sister.

10.verse: And Solomon's son was Rehoboam, Abia his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,

11.verse: Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,

12.verse: Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,

13.verse: Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,

14.verse: Amon his son, Josiah his son.

15.verse: And the sons of Josiah were, the first-born Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum.

16.verse: And the sons of Jehoiakim; Jeconiah his son, Zedekiah his son.

17.verse: And the sons of Jeconiah; Assir, Salathiel his son.

18.verse: Malchiram also, and Pedaiah, and Shenazar, Jecamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.

19.verse: And the sons of Pedaiah were, Zerubbabel, and Shimei: and the sons of Zerubbabel; Meshullam, and Hananiah, and Shelomith their sister:

20.verse: And Hashubah, and Ohel, and Berechiah, and Hasadiah, and Jushab-hesed, five.

21.verse: And the sons of Hananiah; Pelatiah, and Jesaiah: the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of Shechaniah.

22.verse: And the sons of Shechaniah; Shemaiah; and the sons of Shemaiah; Hattush, and Igeal, and Bariah, and Neariah, and Shaphat, six.

23.verse: And the sons of Neariah; Elioenai, and Hezekiah, and Azrikam, three.

24.verse: And the sons of Elioenai were, Hodaiah, and Eliashib, and Pelaiah, and Akkub, and Johanan, and Delaiah, and Anani, seven.

1.verse: The sons of Judah; Pharez, Hezron, and Carmi, and Hur, and Shobal.

2.verse: And Reaiah the son of Shobal begat Jahath; and Jahath begat Ahumai, and Lahad. These are the families of the Zorathites.

3.verse: And these were of the father of Etam; Jezreel, and Ishma, and Idbash: and the name of their sister was Hazelelponi:

4.verse: And Penuel the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These are the sons of Hur, the first-born of Ephratah, the father of Beth-lehem.

5.verse: And Ashur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.

6.verse: And Naarah bore him Ahuzam, and Hepher, and Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.

7.verse: And the sons of Helah were, Zereth, and Jezoar, and Ethnan.

8.verse: And Coz begat Anub, and Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.

9.verse: And Jabez was more honorable than his brethren: and his mother called his name Jabez, saying, Because I bore him with sorrow.

10.verse: And Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, Oh that thou wouldst bless me indeed, and enlarge my border, and that thy hand might be with me, and that thou wouldst keep me from evil, that it may not grieve me! And God granted him that which he requested.

11.verse: And Chelub the brother of Shuah begat Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.

12.verse: And Eshton begat Beth-rapha, and Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir-nahash. These are the men of Rechah.

13.verse: And the sons of Kenaz; Othniel, and Seraiah: and the sons of Othniel; Hathath.

14.verse: And Meonothai begat Ophrah: and Seraiah begat Joab, the father of the valley of Charashim; for they were artificers.

15.verse: And the sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh; Iru, Elah, and Naam: and the sons of Elah, even Kenaz.

16.verse: And the sons of Jehaleleel; Ziph, and Ziphah, Tiria, and Asareel.

17.verse: And the sons of Ezra were, Jethur, and Mered, and Epher, and Jalon: and she bore Miriam, and Shammai, and Ishbah the father of Eshtemoa.

18.verse: And his wife Jehudijah bore Jered the father of Gedor, and Heber the father of Socho, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah. And these are the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh whom Mered took.

19.verse: And the sons of his wife Hodiah the sister of Naham, the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa the Maachathite.

20.verse: And the sons of Shimon were, Amnon, and Rinnah, Ben-hanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi were, Zoheth, and Benzoheth.

21.verse: The sons of Shelah the son of Judah were, Er the father of Lecah, and Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of the house of them that wrought fine linen, of the house of Ashbea,

22.verse: And Jokim, and the men of Chozeba, and Joash, and Saraph, who had the dominion in Moab, and Jashubi-lehem. And these are ancient things.

23.verse: These were the potters, and those that dwelt among plants and hedges: there they dwelt with the king for his work.

24.verse: The sons of Simeon were Nemuel, and Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, and Shaul:

25.verse: Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.

26.verse: And the sons of Mishma; Hamuel his son, Zacchur his son, Shimei his son.

27.verse: And Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brethren had not many children, neither did all their family multiply, like the children of Judah.

28.verse: And they dwelt at Beer-sheba, and Moladah, and Hazar-shual,

29.verse: And at Bilhah, and at Ezem, and at Tolad,

30.verse: And at Bethuel, and at Hormah, and at Ziklag,

31.verse: And at Beth-marcaboth, and Hazar-susim, and at Beth-birei, and at Shaaraim. These were their cities to the reign of David.

32.verse: And their villages were, Etam, and Ain, Rimmon, and Tochen, and Ashan, five cities:

33.verse: And all their villages that were around the same cities to Baal. These were their habitations, and their genealogy.

34.verse: And Meshobab, and Jamlech, and Joshah the son of Amaziah,

35.verse: And Joel, and Jehu the son of Josibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,

36.verse: And Elioenai, and Jaakobah, and Jeshohaiah, and Asaiah, and Adiel, and Jesimiel, and Benaiah,

37.verse: And Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah;

38.verse: These mentioned by their names were princes in their families: and the house of their fathers increased greatly.

39.verse: And they went to the entrance of Gedor, even to the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.

40.verse: And they found rich pasture and good, and the land was wide, and quiet, and peaceable; for they of Ham had dwelt there of old.

41.verse: And these written by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and smote their tents, and the habitations that were found there, and destroyed them utterly to this day, and dwelt in their room: because there was pasture there for their flocks.

42.verse: And some of them, even of the sons of Simeon, five hundred men, went to mount Seir, having for their captains Pelatiah, and Neariah, and Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.

43.verse: And they smote the rest of the Amalekites that had escaped, and have dwelt there to this day.

1.verse: Now the sons of Reuben the first-born of Israel, (for he was the first-born; but, forasmuch as he defiled his father's bed, his birth-right was given to the sons of Joseph the son of Israel: and the genealogy is not to be reckoned after the birth-right.

2.verse: For Judah prevailed above his brethren, and of him came the chief ruler; but the birth-right was Joseph's:)

3.verse: The sons, I say, of Reuben the first-born of Israel were, Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

4.verse: The sons of Joel; Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,

5.verse: Micah his son, Reaia his son, Baal his son,

6.verse: Beerah his son, whom Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria carried away captive: he was prince of the Reubenites.

7.verse: And his brethren by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was reckoned, were the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,

8.verse: And Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who dwelt in Aroer, even to Nebo, and Baal-meon:

9.verse: And eastward he inhabited to the entrance of the wilderness from the river Euphrates: because their cattle were multiplied in the land of Gilead.

10.verse: And in the days of Saul they made war with the Hagarites, who fell by their hand: and they dwelt in their tents throughout all the east land of Gilead.

11.verse: And the children of Gad dwelt over against them, in the land of Bashan to Salcah:

12.verse: Joel the chief, and Shapham the next, and Jaanai, and Shaphat in Bashan.

13.verse: And their brethren of the house of their fathers were, Michael, and Meshullam, and Sheba, and Jorai, and Jachan, and Zia, and Heber, seven.

14.verse: These are the children of Abihail the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son of Jeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;

15.verse: Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, chief of the house of their fathers.

16.verse: And they dwelt in Gilead in Bashan, and in its towns, and in all the suburbs of Sharon, upon their borders.

17.verse: All these were reckoned by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.

18.verse: The sons of Reuben, and the Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh, of valiant men, men able to bear buckler and sword, and to shoot with bow, and skillful in war, were four and forty thousand seven hundred and sixty, that went out to the war.

19.verse: And they made war with the Hagarites, with Jetur, and Nephish, and Nodab.

20.verse: And they were helped against them, and the Hagarites were delivered into their hand, and all that were with them: for they cried to God in the battle, and he was entreated by them; because they put their trust in him.

21.verse: And they took away their cattle; of their camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred and fifty thousand, and of asses two thousand, and of men a hundred thousand.

22.verse: For there fell down many slain, because the war was of God. And they dwelt in their steads until the captivity.

23.verse: And the children of the half tribe of Manasseh dwelt in the land: they increased from Bashan to Baal-hermon and Senir, and to mount Hermon.

24.verse: And these were the heads of the house of their fathers, even Epher, and Ishi, and Eliel, and Azriel, and Jeremiah, and Hodaviah, and Jahdiel, mighty men of valor, famous men, and heads of the house of their fathers.

25.verse: And they transgressed against the God of their fathers, and went astray after the gods of the people of the land, whom God destroyed before them.

26.verse: And the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, and the spirit of Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria, and he carried them away, even the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, and brought them to Halah, and Habor, and Hara, and to the river Gozan, to this day.

1.verse: The sons of Levi; Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

2.verse: And the sons of Kohath; Amram, Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.

3.verse: And the children of Amram; Aaron, and Moses, and Miriam. The sons also of Aaron; Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.

4.verse: Eleazar begat Phinehas, Phinehas begat Abishua,

5.verse: And Abishua begat Bukki, and Bukki begat Uzzi,

6.verse: And Uzzi begat Zerahiah, and Zerahiah begat Meraioth,

7.verse: Meraioth begat Amariah, and Amariah begat Ahitub,

8.verse: And Ahitub begat Zadok, and Zadok begat Ahimaaz,

9.verse: And Ahimaaz begat Azariah, and Azariah begat Johanan,

10.verse: And Johanan begat Azariah, (he it is that executed the priest's office in the temple that Solomon built in Jerusalem:)

11.verse: And Azariah begat Amariah, and Amariah begat Ahitub,

12.verse: And Ahitub begat Zadok, and Zadok begat Shallum,

13.verse: And Shallum begat Hilkiah, and Hilkiah begat Azariah,

14.verse: And Azariah begat Seraiah, and Seraiah begat Jehozadak,

15.verse: And Jehozadak went into captivity, when the LORD carried away Judah and Jerusalem by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.

16.verse: The sons of Levi; Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.

17.verse: And these are the names of the sons of Gershom; Libni, and Shimei.

18.verse: And the sons of Kohath were, Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.

19.verse: The sons of Merari; Mahli, and Mushi. And these are the families of the Levites according to their fathers.

20.verse: Of Gershom; Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,

21.verse: Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, Jeaterai his son.

22.verse: The sons of Kohath; Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,

23.verse: Elkanah his son, and Ebiasaph his son, and Assir his son,

24.verse: Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.

25.verse: And the sons of Elkanah; Amasai, and Ahimoth.

26.verse: As for Elkanah: the sons of Elkanah; Zophai his son, and Nahath his son,

27.verse: Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son.

28.verse: And the sons of Samuel; the first-born Vashni, and Abiah.

29.verse: The sons of Merari; Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzza his son,

30.verse: Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, Asaiah his son.

31.verse: And these are they whom David set over the service of song in the house of the LORD, after that the ark had rest.

32.verse: And they ministered before the dwelling-place of the tabernacle of the congregation with singing, until Solomon had built the house of the LORD in Jerusalem: and then they waited on their office, according to their order.

33.verse: And these are they that waited with their children. Of the sons of the Kohathites: Heman a singer, the son of Joel, the son of Shemuel,

34.verse: The son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,

35.verse: The son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,

36.verse: The son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,

37.verse: The son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,

38.verse: The son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.

39.verse: And his brother Asaph, who stood on his right hand, even Asaph the son of Berechiah, the son of Shimea,

40.verse: The son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchiah,

41.verse: The son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,

42.verse: The son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,

43.verse: The son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.

44.verse: And their brethren the sons of Merari stood on the left hand: Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,

45.verse: The son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,

46.verse: The son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shamer,

47.verse: The son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.

48.verse: Their brethren also the Levites were appointed to all manner of service of the tabernacle of the house of God.

49.verse: But Aaron and his sons offered upon the altar of the burnt-offering, and on the altar of incense, and were appointed for all the work of the place most holy, and to make an atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.

50.verse: And these are the sons of Aaron; Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,

51.verse: Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,

52.verse: Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,

53.verse: Zadok his son, Ahimaaz his son.

54.verse: Now these are their dwelling-places throughout their castles in their limits, of the sons of Aaron, of the families of the Kohathites: for theirs was the lot.

55.verse: And they gave them Hebron in the land of Judah, and its suburbs around it.

56.verse: But the fields of the city, and its villages, they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.

57.verse: And to the sons of Aaron they gave the cities of Judah, namely, Hebron, the city of refuge, and Libnah with its suburbs, and Jattir, and Eshtemoa, with their suburbs,

58.verse: And Hilen with its suburbs, Debir with its suburbs,

59.verse: And Ashan with its suburbs, and Beth-shemesh with its suburbs:

60.verse: And out of the tribe of Benjamin; Geba with its suburbs, and Alemeth with its suburbs, and Anathoth with its suburbs. All their cities throughout their families were thirteen cities.

61.verse: And to the sons of Kohath who were left of the family of that tribe, were cities given out of the half tribe, namely, out of the half tribe of Manasseh, by lot, ten cities.

62.verse: And to the sons of Gershom throughout their families were given out of the tribe of Issachar, and out of the tribe of Asher, and out of the tribe of Naphtali, and out of the tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities.

63.verse: To the sons of Merari were given by lot, throughout their families, out of the tribe of Reuben, and out of the tribe of Gad, and out of the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities.

64.verse: And the children of Israel gave to the Levites these cities with their suburbs.

65.verse: And they gave by lot out of the tribe of the children of Judah, and out of the tribe of the children of Simeon, and out of the tribe of the children of Benjamin, these cities, which are called by their names.

66.verse: And the residue of the families of the sons of Kohath had cities of their borders out of the tribe of Ephraim.

67.verse: And they gave to them, of the cities of refuge, Shechem in mount Ephraim with its suburbs; they gave also Gezer with its suburbs,

68.verse: And Jokmeam with its suburbs, and Beth-horon with its suburbs,

69.verse: And Ajalon with its suburbs, and Gath-rimmon with its suburbs:

70.verse: And out of the half tribe of Manasseh; Aner with its suburbs, and Bileam with its suburbs, for the family of the remnant of the sons of Kohath.

71.verse: To the sons of Gershom were given out of the family of the half tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan with its suburbs, and Ashtaroth with its suburbs:

72.verse: And out of the tribe of Issachar; Kedesh with its suburbs, Daberath with its suburbs,

73.verse: And Ramoth with its suburbs, and Anem with its suburbs:

74.verse: And out of the tribe of Asher; Mashal with its suburbs, and Abdon with its suburbs,

75.verse: And Hukok with its suburbs, and Rehob with its suburbs:

76.verse: And out of the tribe of Naphtali: Kedesh in Galilee with its suburbs, and Hammon with its suburbs, and Kirjathaim with its suburbs.

77.verse: To the rest of the children of Merari were given out of the tribe of Zebulun, Rimmon with its suburbs, Tabor with its suburbs:

78.verse: And on the other side of Jordan by Jericho, on the east side of Jordan, were given them out of the tribe of Reuben, Bezer in the wilderness with its suburbs, and Jahzah with its suburbs,

79.verse: Kedemoth also with its suburbs, and Mephaath with its suburbs:

80.verse: And out of the tribe of Gad; Ramoth in Gilead with its suburbs, and Mahanaim with its suburbs,

81.verse: And Heshbon with its suburbs, and Jazer with its suburbs.

1.verse: Now the sons of Issachar, were, Tola, and Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four.

2.verse: And the sons of Tola; Uzzi, and Rephaiah, and Jeriel, and Jahmai, and Jibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their father's house, to wit, of Tola: they were valiant men of might in their generations; whose number was in the days of David two and twenty thousand and six hundred.

3.verse: And the sons of Uzzi; Izrahiah: and the sons of Izrahiah; Michael, and Obadiah, and Joel, Ishaiah, five: all of them chief men.

4.verse: And with them, by their generations, after the house of their fathers, were bands of soldiers for war, six and thirty thousand men: for they had many wives and sons.

5.verse: And their brethren among all the families of Issachar were valiant men of might, reckoned in all by their genealogies eighty and seven thousand.

6.verse: The sons of Benjamin; Bela, and Becher, and Jediael, three.

7.verse: And the sons of Bela; Ezbon, and Uzzi, and Uzziel, and Jerimoth, and Iri, five; heads of the house of their fathers, mighty men of valor; and were reckoned by their genealogies twenty and two thousand and thirty and four.

8.verse: And the sons of Becher; Zemira, and Joash, and Eliezer, and Elioenai, and Omri, and Jerimoth, and Abiah, and Anathoth, and Alameth. All these are the sons of Becher.

9.verse: And the number of them, after their genealogy by their generations, heads of the house of their fathers, mighty men of valor, was twenty thousand and two hundred.

10.verse: The sons also of Jediael; Bilhan: and the sons of Bilhan; Jeush, and Benjamin, and Ehud, and Chenaanah, and Zethan, and Tharshish, and Ahishahar.

11.verse: All these the sons of Jediael, by the heads of their fathers, mighty men of valor, were seventeen thousand and two hundred soldiers, fit to go out for war and battle.

12.verse: Shuppim also, and Huppim, the children of Ir, and Hushim, the sons of Aher.

13.verse: The sons of Naphtali; Jahziel, and Guni, and Jezer, and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.

14.verse: The sons of Manasseh; Ashriel, whom she bore: (but his concubine the Aramitess bore Machir the father of Gilead:

15.verse: And Machir took for a wife the sister of Huppim and Shuppim, whose sister's name was Maachah;) and the name of the second was Zelophehad: and Zelophehad had daughters.

16.verse: And Maachah the wife of Machir bore a son, and she called his name Peresh; and the name of his brother was Sheresh; and his sons were Ulam, and Rakem.

17.verse: And the sons of Ulam; Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.

18.verse: And his sister Hammoleketh bore Ishod, and Abiezer, and Mahalah.

19.verse: And the sons of Shemida were, Ahian, and Shechem, and Likhi, and Aniam.

20.verse: And the sons of Ephraim; Shuthelah, and Bered his son, and Tahath his son, and Eladah his son, and Tahath his son,

21.verse: And Zabad his son, and Shuthelah his son, and Ezer, and Elead, whom the men of Gath that were born in that land slew, because they came down to take away their cattle.

22.verse: And Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brethren came to comfort him.

23.verse: And when he went in to his wife, she conceived and bore a son, and he called his name Beriah, because it went evil with his house.

24.verse: (And his daughter was Sherah, who built Beth-horon the nether, and the upper, and Uzzen-sherah.)

25.verse: And Rephah was his son, also Resheph, and Telah his son, and Tahan his son,

26.verse: Laadan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,

27.verse: Non his son, Jehoshua his son.

28.verse: And their possessions and habitations were, Beth-el, and its towns, and eastward Naaram, and westward Gezer, with its towns; Shechem also and its towns, to Gaza and its towns:

29.verse: And by the borders of the children of Manasseh, Beth-shean and its towns, Taanach and its towns, Megiddo and its towns, Dor and its towns. In these dwelt the children of Joseph the son of Israel.

30.verse: The sons of Asher; Imnah, and Isuah, and Ishua, and Beriah, and Serah their sister.

31.verse: And the sons of Beriah; Heber, and Malchiel, who is the father of Birzavith.

32.verse: And Heber begat Japhlet, and Shomer, and Hotham, and Shua their sister.

33.verse: And the sons of Japhlet; Pasach, and Bimhal, and Ashvath. These are the children of Japhlet.

34.verse: And the sons of Shamer; Ahi, and Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.

35.verse: And the sons of his brother Helem; Zophah, and Imna, and Shelesh, and Amal.

36.verse: The sons of Zophah; Suah, and Harnepher, and Shual, and Beri, and Imrah,

37.verse: Bezer, and Hod, and Shamma, and Shilshah, and Ithran, and Beera.

38.verse: And the sons of Jether; Jephunneh, and Pispah, and Ara.

39.verse: And the sons of Ulla; Arah, and Haniel, and Rezia.

40.verse: All these were the children of Asher, heads of their father's house, choice and mighty men of valor, chief of the princes. And the number throughout the genealogy of them that were fit for war and for battle was twenty and six thousand men.

1.verse: Now Benjamin begat Bela his first-born, Ashbel the second, and Aharah the third.

2.verse: Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.

3.verse: And the sons of Bela were Addar, and Gera, and Abihud,

4.verse: And Abishua, and Naaman, and Ahoah,

5.verse: And Gera, and Shephuphan, and Huram.

6.verse: And these are the sons of Ehud: these are the heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Geba, and they removed them to Manahath:

7.verse: And Naaman, and Ahiah, and Gera, he removed them, and begat Uzza, and Ahihud.

8.verse: And Shaharaim begat children in the country of Moab, after he had sent them away; Hushim and Baara were his wives.

9.verse: And he begat of Hodesh his wife, Jobab, and Zibia, and Mesha, and Malcham,

10.verse: And Jeuz, and Shachia, and Mirma. These were his sons, heads of the fathers.

11.verse: And of Hushim he begat Ahitub, and Elpaal.

12.verse: The sons of Elpaal; Eber, and Misham, and Shamed, who built Ono, and Lod, with its town:

13.verse: Beriah also, and Shema, who were heads of the fathers of the inhabitants of Ajalon, who drove away the inhabitants of Gath:

14.verse: And Ahio, Shashak, and Jeremoth,

15.verse: And Zebadiah, and Arad, and Ader,

16.verse: And Michael, and Ispah, and Joha, the sons of Beriah;

17.verse: And Zebadiah, and Meshullam, and Hezeki, and Heber,

18.verse: Ishmerai also, and Jezliah, and Jobab, the sons of Elpaal;

19.verse: And Jakim, and Zichri, and Zabdi,

20.verse: And Elienai, and Zilthai, and Eliel,

21.verse: And Adaiah, and Beraiah, and Shimrath, the sons of Shimhi;

22.verse: And Ishpan, and Heber, and Eliel,

23.verse: And  Abdon, and Zichri, and Hanan,

24.verse: And Hananiah, and Elam, and Antothijah,

25.verse: And Iphedeiah, and Penuel, the sons of Shashak;

26.verse: And Shamsherai, and Shehariah, and Athaliah,

27.verse: And Jaresiah, and Eliah, and Zichri, the sons of Jeroham.

28.verse: These were heads of the fathers, by their generations, chief men. These dwelt in Jerusalem.

29.verse: And at Gibeon dwelt the father of Gibeon; whose wife's name was Maachah:

30.verse: And his first-born son Abdon, and Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Nadab,

31.verse: And Gedor, and Ahio, and Zacher.

32.verse: And Mikloth begat Shimeah. And these also dwelt with their brethren in Jerusalem, over against them.

33.verse: And Ner begat Kish, and Kish begat Saul, and Saul begat Jonathan, and Malchi-shua, and Abinadab, and Esh-baal.

34.verse: And the son of Jonathan was Merib-baal; and Merib-baal begat Micah.

35.verse: And the sons of Micah were, Pithon, and Melech, and Tarea, and Ahaz.

36.verse: And Ahaz begat Jehoadah; and Jehoadah begat Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri begat Moza,

37.verse: And Moza begat Bineah: Rapha was his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son:

38.verse: And Azel had six sons, whose names are these, Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan. All these were the sons of Azel.

39.verse: And the sons of Eshek his brother were, Ulam his first-born, Jehush the second, and Eliphelet the third.

40.verse: And the sons of Ulam were mighty men of valor, archers, and had many sons, and sons' sons a hundred and fifty. All these are of the sons of Benjamin.

1.verse: So all Israel were reckoned by genealogies; and behold, they were written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah, who were carried away to Babylon for their transgression.

2.verse: Now the first inhabitants that dwelt in their possessions in their cities were, the Israelites, the priests, Levites, and the Nethinims.

3.verse: And in Jerusalem dwelt of the children of Judah, and of the children of Benjamin, and of the children of Ephraim, and Manasseh;

4.verse: Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, of the children of Pharez the son of Judah.

5.verse: And of the Shilonites; Asaiah the first-born, and his sons.

6.verse: And of the sons of Zerah; Jeuel, and their brethren, six hundred and ninety.

7.verse: And of the sons of Benjamin; Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hasenuah,

8.verse: And Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, and Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri, and Meshullam the son of Shephatiah, the son of Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;

9.verse: And their brethren, according to their generations, nine hundred and fifty and six. All these men were chief of the fathers in the house of their fathers.

10.verse: And of the priests; Jedaiah, and Jehoiarib, and Jachin,

11.verse: And Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the ruler of the house of God;

12.verse: And Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashur, the son of Malchijah, and Maasiai the son of Adiel, the son of Jahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;

13.verse: And their brethren, heads of the house of their fathers, a thousand and seven hundred and sixty; very able men for the work of the service of the house of God.

14.verse: And of the Levites; Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;

15.verse: And Bakbakkar, Heresh, and Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Micah, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph;

16.verse: And Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah, that dwelt in the villages of the Netophathites.

17.verse: And the porters were Shallum, and Akkub, and Talmon, and Ahiman, and their brethren: Shallum was the chief;

18.verse: Who hitherto waited in the king's gate eastward: they were porters in the companies of the children of Levi.

19.verse: And Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brethren of the house of his father, the Korahites, were over the work of the service, keepers of the gates of the tabernacle: and their fathers, being over the host of the LORD, were keepers of the entry.

20.verse: And Phinehas the son of Eleazar was the ruler over them in time past, and the LORD was with him.

21.verse: And Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was porter of the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

22.verse: All these who were chosen to be porters in the gates were two hundred and twelve. These were reckoned by their genealogy in their villages, whom David and Samuel the seer ordained in their set office.

23.verse: So they and their children had the oversight of the gates of the house of the LORD, namely, the house of the tabernacle, by wards.

24.verse: In four quarters were the porters, towards the east, west, north and south.

25.verse: And their brethren, who were in their villages, were to come after seven days from time to time with them.

26.verse: For these Levites, the four chief porters, were in their set office, and were over the chambers and treasuries of the house of God.

27.verse: And they lodged about the house of God, because the charge was upon them, and the opening of it every morning pertained to them.

28.verse: And certain of them had the charge of the ministering vessels, that they should bring them in and out by number.

29.verse: Some of them also were appointed to oversee the vessels, and all the instruments of the sanctuary, and the fine flour, and the wine, and the oil, and the frankincense, and the spices.

30.verse: And some of the sons of the priests made the ointment of the spices.

31.verse: And Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the first-born of Shallum the Korahite, had the set office over the things that were made in the pans.

32.verse: And others of their brethren, of the sons of the Kohathites, were over the show-bread, to prepare it every sabbath.

33.verse: And these are the singers, chief of the fathers of the Levites, who remaining in the chambers were free: for they were employed in that work day and night.

34.verse: These chief fathers of the Levites were chief throughout their generations; these dwelt at Jerusalem.

35.verse: And in Gibeon dwelt the father of Gibeon, Jehiel, whose wife's name was Maachah:

36.verse: And his first-born son Abdon, then Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Ner, and Nadab,

37.verse: And Gedor, and Ahio, and Zechariah, and Mikloth.

38.verse: And Mikloth begat Shimeam. And they also dwelt with their brethren at Jerusalem, over against their brethren.

39.verse: And Ner begat Kish; and Kish begat Saul; and Saul begat Jonathan, and Malchi-shua, and Abinadab, and Esh-baal.

40.verse: And the son of Jonathan was Merib-baal: and Merib-baal begat Micah.

41.verse: And the sons of Micah were, Pithon, and Melech, and Tahrea, and Ahaz.

42.verse: And Ahaz begat Jarah; and Jarah begat Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri begat Moza;

43.verse: And Moza begat Binea; and Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.

44.verse: And Azel had six sons, whose names are these, Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan: these were the sons of Azel.

1.verse: Now the Philistines fought against Israel; and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain in mount Gilboa.

2.verse: And the Philistines followed hard after Saul, and after his sons; and the Philistines slew Jonathan, and Abinadab, and Malchi-shua, the sons of Saul.

3.verse: And the battle prevailed against Saul, and the archers hit him, and he was wounded by the archers.

4.verse: Then said Saul to his armor-bearer, Draw thy sword, and thrust me through therewith; lest these uncircumcised come and abuse me. But his armor-bearer would not; for he was greatly afraid. So Saul took a sword, and fell upon it.

5.verse: And when his armor-bearer saw that Saul was dead, he fell likewise on the sword, and died.

6.verse: So Saul died, and his three sons, and all his house died together.

7.verse: And when all the men of Israel that were in the valley saw that they fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, then they forsook their cities, and fled: and the Philistines came and dwelt in them.

8.verse: And it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and his sons fallen in mount Gilboa.

9.verse: And when they had stripped him, they took his head, and his armor, and sent into the land of the Philistines around, to carry tidings to their idols, and to the people.

10.verse: And they put his armor in the house of their gods, and fastened his head in the temple of Dagon.

11.verse: And when all Jabesh-gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul,

12.verse: They arose, all the valiant men, and took away the body of Saul, and the bodies of his sons, and brought them to Jabesh, and buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh, and fasted seven days.

13.verse: So Saul died for his transgression which he committed against the LORD, even against the word of the LORD, which he kept not, and also for asking counsel of one that had a familiar spirit, to inquire of it;

14.verse: And inquired not of the LORD: therefore he slew him, and turned the kingdom to David the son of Jesse.

1.verse: Then all Israel gathered themselves to David to Hebron, saying, Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh.

2.verse: And moreover in time past, even when Saul was king, thou wast he that leddest out and broughtest in Israel: and the LORD thy God said to thee, Thou shalt feed my people Israel, and thou shalt be ruler over my people Israel.

3.verse: Therefore came all the elders of Israel to the king to Hebron; and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the LORD; and they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the LORD by Samuel.

4.verse: And David and all Israel went to Jerusalem, which is Jebus; where the Jebusites were, the inhabitants of the land.

5.verse: And the inhabitants of Jebus said to David, Thou shalt not come hither. Nevertheless David took the castle of Zion, which is the city of David.

6.verse: And David said, Whoever smiteth the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain. So Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, and was chief.

7.verse: And David dwelt in the castle; therefore they called it, The city of David.

8.verse: And he built the city around, even from Millo around: and Joab repaired the rest of the city.

9.verse: So David became greater and greater: for the LORD of hosts was with him.

10.verse: These also are the chief of the mighty men whom David had, who strengthened themselves with him in his kingdom, and with all Israel, to make him king according to the word of the LORD concerning Israel.

11.verse: And this is the number of the mighty men whom David had; Jashobeam a Hachmonite, the chief of the captains: he lifted his spear against three hundred slain by him at one time.

12.verse: And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighties.

13.verse: He was with David at Pas-dammim, and there the Philistines were gathered to battle, where was a parcel of ground full of barley; and the people fled from before the Philistines.

14.verse: And they set themselves in the midst of that parcel, and delivered it, and slew the Philistines; and the LORD saved them by a great deliverance.

15.verse: Now three of the thirty captains went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam; and the host of the Philistines encamped in the valley of Rephaim.

16.verse: And David was then in the hold, and the Philistines' garrison was then at Beth-lehem.

17.verse: And David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me drink of the water of the well of Beth-lehem, that is at the gate!

18.verse: And the three broke through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Beth-lehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: but David would not drink of it, but poured it out to the LORD,

19.verse: And said, My God forbid it me, that I should do this thing: shall I drink the blood of these men that have put their lives in jeopardy? for with the jeopardy of their lives they brought it. Therefore he would not drink it. These things did these three mightiest.

20.verse: And Abishai the brother of Joab, he was chief of the three: for lifting his spear against three hundred, he slew them, and had a name among the three.

21.verse: Of the three, he was more honorable than the two; for he was their captain: but he attained not to the first three.

22.verse: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done many acts; he slew two lion-like men of Moab: also he went down and slew a lion in a pit in a snowy day.

23.verse: And he slew an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits high; and in the Egyptian's hand was a spear like a weaver's beam; and he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian's hand, and slew him with his own spear.

24.verse: These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had the name among the three mighties.

25.verse: Behold, he was honorable among the thirty, but attained not to the first three: and David set him over his guard.

26.verse: Also the valiant men of the armies were, Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Beth-lehem,

27.verse: Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,

28.verse: Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Antothite,

29.verse: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,

30.verse: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,

31.verse: Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah, that pertained to the children of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,

32.verse: Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,

33.verse: Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,

34.verse: The sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shage the Hararite,

35.verse: Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphel the son of Ur,

36.verse: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,

37.verse: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,

38.verse: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Haggeri,

39.verse: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armor-bearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah,

40.verse: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,

41.verse: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,

42.verse: Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a captain of the Reubenites, and thirty with him,

43.verse: Hanan the son of Maachah, and Joshaphat the Mithnite,

44.verse: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jehiel the sons of Hothan the Aroerite,

45.verse: Jediael the son of Shimri, and Joha his brother, the Tizite,

46.verse: Eliel the Mehavite, and Jeribai, and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite,

47.verse: Eliel, and Obed, and Jasiel the Mesobaite.

1.verse: Now these are they that came to David to Ziklag, while he yet kept himself close because of Saul the son of Kish: and they were among the mighty men, helpers of the war.

2.verse: They were armed with bows, and could use both the right hand and the left in hurling stones, and shooting arrows from a bow, even of Saul's brethren of Benjamin.

3.verse: The chief was Ahiezer, then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite; and Jeziel, and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth; and Berachah, and Jehu the Antothite,

4.verse: And Ismaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the thirty, and over the thirty; and Jeremiah, and Jahaziel, and Johanan, and Josabad the Gederathite,

5.verse: Eluzai, and Jerimoth, and Bealiah, and Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Haruphite,

6.verse: Elkanah, and Jesiah, and Azareel, and Joezer, and Jashobeam, the Korhites.

7.verse: And Joelah, and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.

8.verse: And of the Gadites there separated themselves to David in the hold in the wilderness men of might, and men of war fit for the battle, that could handle shield and buckler, whose faces were like the faces of lions, and were as swift as the roes upon the mountains;

9.verse: Ezer the first, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,

10.verse: Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,

11.verse: Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,

12.verse: Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,

13.verse: Jeremiah the tenth, Machbanai the eleventh.

14.verse: These were of the sons of Gad, captains of the host: one of the least was over a hundred, and the greatest over a thousand.

15.verse: These are they that went over Jordan in the first month, when it had overflowed all its banks; and they put to flight all them of the valleys, both towards the east, and towards the west.

16.verse: And there came of the children of Benjamin and Judah to the hold to David.

17.verse: And David went out to meet them, and answered and said to them, If ye have come peaceably to me to help me, my heart shall be knit to you: but if ye have come to betray me to my enemies, seeing there is no wrong in my hands, the God of our fathers look on it, and rebuke it.

18.verse: Then the spirit came upon Amasai, who was chief of the captains, and he said, Thine are we, David, and on thy side, thou son of Jesse: peace, peace be to thee, and peace be to thy helpers; for thy God helpeth thee. Then David received them, and made them captains of the band.

19.verse: And there fell some of Manasseh to David, when he came with the Philistines against Saul to battle: but they helped them not: for the lords of the Philistines upon advisement sent him away, saying, He will fall to his master Saul to the jeopardy of our heads.

20.verse: And as he went to Ziklag, there fell to him of Manasseh, Adnah, and Jozabad, and Jediael, and Michael, and Jozabad, and Elihu, and Zilthai, captains of the thousands that were of Manasseh.

21.verse: And they helped David against the band of the rovers: for they were all mighty men of valor, and were captains in the host.

22.verse: For at that time day by day there came to David to help him, until it was a great host, like the host of God.

23.verse: And these are the numbers of the bands that were ready armed to the war, and came to David to Hebron, to turn the kingdom of Saul to him, according to the word of the LORD.

24.verse: The children of Judah that bore shield and spear were six thousand and eight hundred, ready armed for war.

25.verse: Of the children of Simeon, mighty men of valor for war, seven thousand and one hundred.

26.verse: Of the children of Levi four thousand and six hundred.

27.verse: And Jehoiada was the leader of the Aaronites, and with him were three thousand and seven hundred;

28.verse: And Zadok, a young man mighty of valor, and of his father's house twenty and two captains.

29.verse: And of the children of Benjamin, the kindred of Saul, three thousand: for hitherto the greatest part of them had kept the ward of the house of Saul.

30.verse: And of the children of Ephraim twenty thousand and eight hundred, mighty men of valor, famous throughout the house of their fathers.

31.verse: And of the half tribe of Manasseh eighteen thousand, who were expressed by name, to come and make David king.

32.verse: And of the children of Issachar, who were men that had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do; the heads of them were two hundred; and all their brethren were at their command.

33.verse: Of Zebulun, such as went forth to battle, expert in war, with all instruments of war, fifty thousand, who could keep rank: they were not of double heart.

34.verse: And of Naphtali a thousand captains, and with them with shield and spear thirty and seven thousand.

35.verse: And of the Danites expert in war twenty and eight thousand and six hundred.

36.verse: And of Asher, such as went forth to battle, expert in war, forty thousand.

37.verse: And on the other side of Jordan, of the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and of the half tribe of Manasseh, with all manner of instruments of war for the battle, a hundred and twenty thousand.

38.verse: All these men of war, that could keep rank, came with a perfect heart to Hebron, to make David king over all Israel: and all the rest also of Israel were of one heart to make David king.

39.verse: And there they were with David three days, eating and drinking: for their brethren had prepared for them.

40.verse: Moreover, they that were nigh them, even to Issachar, and Zebulun, and Naphtali, brought bread on asses, and on camels, and on mules, and on oxen, and provision, meal, cakes of figs, and bunches of raisins, and wine, and oil, and oxen, and sheep abundantly: for there was joy in Israel.

1.verse: And David consulted with the captains of thousands, and of hundreds, and with every leader.

2.verse: And David said to all the congregation of Israel, If it seemeth good to you, and that it is of the LORD our God, let us send abroad to our brethren every where, that are left in all the land of Israel, and with them also to the priests and Levites who are in their cities and suburbs, that they may assemble to us:

3.verse: And let us bring again to us the ark of our God: for we inquired not at it in the days of Saul.

4.verse: And all the congregation said that they would do so: for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.

5.verse: So David assembled all Israel, from Shihor of Egypt even to the entrance of Hemath, to bring the ark of God from Kirjath-jearim.

6.verse: And David went up, and all Israel, to Baalah, that is, to Kirjath-jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up thence the ark of God the LORD, that dwelleth between the cherubim, whose name is called on it.

7.verse: And they carried the ark of God in a new cart out of the house of Abinadab: and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.

8.verse: And David and all Israel played before God with all their might, and with singing, and with harps, and with psalteries, and with timbrels, and with cymbals, and with trumpets.

9.verse: And when they came to the threshing-floor of Chidon, Uzza put forth his hand to hold the ark; for the oxen stumbled.

10.verse: And the anger of the LORD was kindled against Uzza, and he smote him, because he put his hand to the ark: and there he died before God.

11.verse: And David was displeased, because the LORD had made a breach upon Uzza: wherefore that place is called Perez-uzza to this day.

12.verse: And David was afraid of God that day, saying, How shall I bring the ark of God home to me?

13.verse: So David brought not the ark to himself to the city of David, but carried it aside into the house of Obed-edom the Gittite.

14.verse: And the ark of God remained with the family of Obed-edom in his house three months. And the LORD blessed the house of Obed-edom, and all that he had.

1.verse: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and timber of cedars, with masons and carpenters, to build him a house.

2.verse: And David perceived that the LORD had confirmed him king over Israel, for his kingdom was exalted on high, because of his people Israel.

3.verse: And David took more wives at Jerusalem: and David begat more sons and daughters.

4.verse: Now these are the names of his children which he had in Jerusalem; Shammua, and Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon,

5.verse: And Ibhar, and Elishua, and Elpalet,

6.verse: And Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,

7.verse: And Elishama, and Beeliada, and Eliphalet.

8.verse: And when the Philistines heard that David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David. And David heard of it, and went out against them.

9.verse: And the Philistines came and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.

10.verse: And David inquired of God, saying, Shall I go up against the Philistines? and wilt thou deliver them into my hand? And the LORD said to him, Go up; for I will deliver them into thy hand.

11.verse: So they came up to Baal-perazim; and David smote them there. Then David said, God hath broken in upon my enemies by my hand like the breaking forth of waters: therefore they called the name of that place Baal-perazim.

12.verse: And when they had left their gods there, David gave a commandment, and they were burned with fire.

13.verse: And the Philistines yet again spread themselves abroad in the valley.

14.verse: Therefore David inquired again of God: and God said to him, Go not up after them; turn away from them, and come upon them over against the mulberry trees.

15.verse: And it shall be, when thou shalt hear a sound of going in the tops of the mulberry trees, then thou shalt go out to battle: for God hath gone forth before thee to smite the host of the Philistines.

16.verse: David therefore did as God commanded him: and they smote the host of the Philistines from Gibeon even to Gazer.

17.verse: And the fame of David went out into all lands; and the LORD brought the fear of him upon all nations.

1.verse: And David made him houses in the city of David, and prepared a place for the ark of God, and pitched for it a tent.

2.verse: Then David said, None ought to carry the ark of God but the Levites: for them hath the LORD chosen to carry the ark of God, and to minister to him for ever.

3.verse: And David assembled all Israel to Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the LORD to its place, which he had prepared for it.

4.verse: And David assembled the children of Aaron, and the Levites:

5.verse: Of the sons of Kohath; Uriel the chief, and his brethren a hundred and twenty:

6.verse: Of the sons of Merari; Asaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred and twenty:

7.verse: Of the sons of Gershom; Joel the chief, and his brethren a hundred and thirty:

8.verse: Of the sons of Elizaphan; Shemaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred:

9.verse: Of the sons of Hebron; Eliel the chief, and his brethren eighty:

10.verse: Of the sons of Uzziel: Amminadab the chief, and his brethren a hundred and twelve.

11.verse: And David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites, for Uriel, Asaiah, and Joel, Shemaiah, and Eliel, and Amminadab,

12.verse: And said to them, Ye are the chief of the fathers of the Levites: sanctify yourselves, both ye and your brethren, that ye may bring up the ark of the LORD God of Israel to the place that I have prepared for it.

13.verse: For because ye did it not at the first, the LORD our God made a breach upon us, for that we sought him not after the due order.

14.verse: So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of the LORD God of Israel.

15.verse: And the children of the Levites bore the ark of God upon their shoulders with the staffs on it, as Moses commanded, according to the word of the LORD.

16.verse: And David spoke to the chief of the Levites to appoint their brethren to be the singers with instruments of music, psalteries, and harps, and cymbals, sounding, by lifting up the voice with joy.

17.verse: So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brethren, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of the sons of Merari their brethren, Ethan the son of Kushaiah;

18.verse: And with them their brethren of the second degree, Zechariah, Ben, and Jaaziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, Eliab, and Benaiah, and Maaseiah, and Mattithiah, and Elipheleh, and Mikneiah, and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, the porters.

19.verse: So the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were appointed to sound with cymbals of brass;

20.verse: And Zechariah, and Aziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with psalteries on Alamoth;

21.verse: And Mattithiah, and Elipheleh, and Mikneiah, and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, and Azaziah, with harps on the Sheminith to excel.

22.verse: And Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was for song: he instructed about the song, because he was skillful.

23.verse: And Berechiah and Elkanah were door-keepers for the ark.

24.verse: And Shebaniah, and Jehoshaphat, and Nethaneel, and Amasai, and Zechariah, and Benaiah, and Eliezer the priests, did blow with the trumpets before the ark of God: and Obed-edom and Jehiah were door-keepers for the ark.

25.verse: So David and the elders of Israel, and the captains over thousands, went to bring up the ark of the covenant of the LORD from the house of Obed-edom with joy.

26.verse: And it came to pass, when God helped the Levites that bore the ark of the covenant of the LORD, that they offered seven bullocks and seven rams.

27.verse: And David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, and all the Levites that bore the ark, and the singers, and Chenaniah the master of the song with the singers: David also had upon him an ephod of linen.

28.verse: Thus all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the LORD with shouting, and with sound of the cornet, and with trumpets, and with cymbals, making a noise with psalteries and harps.

29.verse: And it came to pass, as the ark of the covenant of the LORD came to the city of David, that Michal the daughter of Saul, looking out at a window, saw king David dancing and playing: and she despised him in her heart.

1.verse: So they brought the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it: and they offered burnt-sacrifices and peace-offerings before God.

2.verse: And when David had made an end of offering the burnt-offerings and the peace-offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD.

3.verse: And he dealt to every one of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread, and a good piece of flesh, and a flagon of wine.

4.verse: And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of the LORD, and to record, and to thank and praise the LORD God of Israel:

5.verse: Asaph the chief, and next to him Zechariah, Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah, and Obed-edom: and Jeiel with psalteries and with harps; but Asaph made a sound with cymbals;

6.verse: Benaiah also and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.

7.verse: Then on that day David delivered first this psalm to thank the LORD into the hand of Asaph and his brethren.

8.verse: Give thanks to the LORD, call upon his name, make known his deeds among the people.

9.verse: Sing to him, sing psalms to him, talk ye of all his wonderous works.

10.verse: Glory ye in his holy name: let the heart of them rejoice that seek the LORD.

11.verse: Seek the LORD and his strength, seek his face continually.

12.verse: Remember his wonderful works that he hath done, his wonders, and the judgments of his mouth;

13.verse: O ye seed of Israel his servant, ye children of Jacob, his chosen ones.

14.verse: He is the LORD our God; his judgments are in all the earth.

15.verse: Be ye mindful always of his covenant; the word which he commanded to a thousand generations;

16.verse: Even of the covenant which he made with Abraham, and of his oath to Isaac;

17.verse: And which he confirmed to Jacob for a law, and to Israel for an everlasting covenant,

18.verse: Saying, To thee will I give the land of Canaan, the lot of your inheritance;

19.verse: When ye were but few, even a few, and strangers in it.

20.verse: And when they went from nation to nation, and from one kingdom to another people;

21.verse: He suffered no man to do them wrong: yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,

22.verse: Saying, Touch not my anointed, and do my prophets no harm.

23.verse: Sing to the LORD, all the earth; show forth from day to day his salvation.

24.verse: Declare his glory among the heathen; his wonderful works among all nations.

25.verse: For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised: he also is to be feared above all gods.

26.verse: For all the gods of the people are idols: but the LORD made the heavens.

27.verse: Glory and honor are in his presence; strength and gladness are in his place.

28.verse: Give to the LORD, ye kindreds of the people, give to the LORD glory and strength.

29.verse: Give to the LORD the glory due to his name: bring an offering, and come before him: worship the LORD in the beauty of holiness.

30.verse: Fear before him, all the earth: the world also shall be stable, that it be not moved.

31.verse: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice: and let men say among the nations, The LORD reigneth.

32.verse: Let the sea roar, and the fullness thereof: let the fields rejoice, and all that is therein.

33.verse: Then shall the trees of the wood sing at the presence of the LORD, because he cometh to judge the earth.

34.verse: O give thanks to the LORD; for he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever.

35.verse: And say ye, Save us, O God of our salvation, and gather us together, and deliver us from the heathen, that we may give thanks to thy holy name, and glory in thy praise.

36.verse: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel for ever and ever. And all the people said, Amen, and praised the LORD.

37.verse: So he left there before the ark of the covenant of the LORD Asaph and his brethren, to minister before the ark continually, as every day's work required:

38.verse: And Obed-edom with their brethren, sixty and eight; Obed-edom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be porters:

39.verse: And Zadok the priest, and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of the LORD in the high place that was at Gibeon,

40.verse: To offer burnt-offerings to the LORD upon the altar of the burnt-offering continually morning and evening, and to do according to all that is written in the law of the LORD, which he commanded Israel;

41.verse: And with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest that were chosen, who were expressed by name, to give thanks to the LORD, because his mercy endureth for ever;

42.verse: And with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those that should make a sound, and with musical instruments of God. And the sons of Jeduthun were porters.

43.verse: And all the people departed every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house.

1.verse: Now it came to pass, as David sat in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet, Lo, I dwell in a house of cedars, but the ark of the covenant of the LORD remaineth under curtains.

2.verse: Then Nathan said to David, Do all that is in thy heart; for God is with thee.

3.verse: And it came to pass the same night, that the word of God came to Nathan, saying,

4.verse: Go and tell David my servant, Thus saith the LORD, Thou shalt not build me a house to dwell in:

5.verse: For I have not dwelt in a house since the day that I brought up Israel to this day; but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tabernacle to another.

6.verse: Wherever I have walked with all Israel, have I spoken a word to any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded to feed my people, saying, Why have ye not built me a house of cedars?

7.verse: Now therefore thus shalt thou say to my servant David, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, I took thee from the sheep-cote, even from following the sheep, that thou shouldst be ruler over my people Israel:

8.verse: And I have been with thee whithersoever thou hast walked, and have cut off all thy enemies from before thee, and have made thee a name like the name of the great men that are in the earth.

9.verse: Also I will ordain a place for my people Israel, and will plant them, and they shall dwell in their place, and shall be moved no more; neither shall the children of wickedness waste them any more, as at the beginning.

10.verse: And since the time that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. Moreover, I will subdue all thy enemies. Furthermore, I tell thee that the LORD will build thee a house.

11.verse: And it shall come to pass, when thy days shall be ended that thou must go to be with thy fathers, that I will raise up thy seed after thee, who shall be of thy sons; and I will establish his kingdom.

12.verse: He shall build me a house, and I will establish his throne for ever.

13.verse: I will be his father, and he shall be my son: and I will not take my mercy away from him, as I took it from him that was before thee:

14.verse: But I will settle him in my house and in my kingdom for ever: and his throne shall be established for evermore.

15.verse: According to all these words, and according to all this vision, so did Nathan speak to David.

16.verse: And David the king came and sat before the LORD, and said, Who am I, O LORD God, and what is my house, that thou hast brought me hitherto?

17.verse: And yet this was a small thing in thy eyes, O God; for thou hast also spoken of thy servant's house for a great while to come, and hast regarded me according to the estate of a man of high degree, O LORD God.

18.verse: What can David speak more to thee for the honor of thy servant? for thou knowest thy servant.

19.verse: O LORD, for thy servant's sake, and according to thy own heart, hast thou done all this greatness, in making known all these great things.

20.verse: O LORD, there is none like thee, neither is there any God besides thee, according to all that we have heard with our ears.

21.verse: And what one nation in the earth is like thy people Israel, whom God went to redeem to be his own people, to make thee a name of greatness and terribleness, by driving out nations from before thy people, whom thou hast redeemed out of Egypt?

22.verse: For thy people Israel didst thou make thy own people for ever; and thou, LORD, becamest their God.

23.verse: Therefore now, LORD, Let the thing that thou hast spoken concerning thy servant and concerning his house be established for ever, and do as thou hast said.

24.verse: Let it even be established, that thy name may be magnified for ever, saying, The LORD of hosts is the God of Israel, even a God to Israel: and let the house of David thy servant be established before thee.

25.verse: For thou, O my God, hast told thy servant that thou wilt build him a house: therefore thy servant hath found in his heart to pray before thee.

26.verse: And now, LORD, thou art God, and hast promised this goodness to thy servant:

27.verse: Now therefore let it please thee to bless the house of thy servant, that it may be before thee for ever: for thou blessest, O LORD, and it shall be blessed for ever.

1.verse: Now after this it came to pass that David smote the Philistines, and subdued them, and took Gath and its towns out of the hand of the Philistines.

2.verse: And he smote Moab; and the Moabites became David's servants, and brought gifts.

3.verse: And David smote Hadarezer king of Zobah to Hamath, as he went to establish his dominion by the river Euphrates.

4.verse: And David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen: David also houghed all the chariot-horses, but reserved of them a hundred chariots.

5.verse: And when the Syrians of Damascus came to help Hadarezer king of Zobah, David slew of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.

6.verse: Then David put garrisons in Syria-damascus; and the Syrians became David's servants, and brought gifts. Thus the LORD preserved David whithersoever he went.

7.verse: And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadarezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.

8.verse: Likewise from Tibhath, and from Chun, cities of Hadarezer, David brought very much brass, with which Solomon made the brazen sea, and the pillars, and the vessels of brass.

9.verse: Now when Tou king of Hamath heard how David had smitten all the host of Hadarezer king of Zobah;

10.verse: He sent Hadoram his son to king David to inquire of his welfare, and to congratulate him, because he had fought against Hadarezer, and smitten him; (for Hadarezer had warred with Tou;) and with him all manner of vessels of gold, and silver, and brass.

11.verse: Them also king David dedicated to the LORD, with the silver and the gold that he brought from all these nations; from Edom, and from Moab, and from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines, and from Amalek.

12.verse: Moreover, Abishai the son of Zeruiah slew of the Edomites in the valley of salt eighteen thousand.

13.verse: And he put garrisons in Edom; and all the Edomites became David's servants. Thus the LORD preserved David whithersoever he went.

14.verse: So David reigned over all Israel, and executed judgment and justice among all his people.

15.verse: And Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the host; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, recorder;

16.verse: And Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Abimelech the son of Abiathar, were the priests; and Shavsha was scribe;

17.verse: And Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David were chief about the king.

1.verse: Now it came to pass after this, that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his stead.

2.verse: And David said, I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me. And David sent messengers to comfort him concerning his father. So the servants of David came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, to comfort him.

3.verse: But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, Thinkest thou that David doth honor thy father, that he hath sent comforters to thee? are not his servants come to thee to search, and to overthrow, and to explore the land?

4.verse: Wherefore Hanun took David's servants, and shaved them, and cut off their garments in the midst hard by their buttocks, and sent them away.

5.verse: Then there went certain, and told David how the men were served. And he sent to meet them: for the men were greatly ashamed. And the king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards are grown, and then return.

6.verse: And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent a thousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, and out of Syria-maachah, and out of Zobah.

7.verse: So they hired thirty and two thousand chariots, and the king of Maachah and his people, who came and encamped before Medeba. And the children of Ammon assembled from their cities, and came to battle.

8.verse: And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty men.

9.verse: And the children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array before the gate of the city: and the kings that had come were by themselves in the field.

10.verse: Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he selected all the choice of Israel, and put them in array against the Syrians.

11.verse: And the rest of the people he delivered to the hand of Abishai his brother, and they set themselves in array against the children of Ammon.

12.verse: And he said, If the Syrians shall be too strong for me, then thou shalt help me: but if the children of Ammon shall be too strong for thee, then I will help thee.

13.verse: Be of good courage, and let us behave ourselves valiantly for our people, and for the cities of our God: and let the LORD do that which is good in his sight.

14.verse: So Joab and the people that were with him drew nigh before the Syrians to the battle; and they fled before him.

15.verse: And when the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians had fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and entered into the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.

16.verse: And when the Syrians saw that they were defeated before Israel, they sent messengers, and drew forth the Syrians that were beyond the river: and Shophach the captain of the host of Hadarezer went before them.
